extends java.lang.Object

      Prints all possible substrings according to arguments.
      void printSubstringsLeftAlignedLeftTruncated​(java.lang.String stringToSubstring)

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        main method serves development purposes only.
        Parameters:
        args - the args

      • printSubstringsLeftAlignedLeftTruncated

        public void printSubstringsLeftAlignedLeftTruncated​(java.lang.String stringToSubstring)
        Given a String object, it should print all possible substrings of it where in each iteration the rightmost character is left out.
        Parameters:
        stringToSubstring - the string to substring

      • printAllSubstrings

        public void printAllSubstrings​(java.lang.String stringToSubstring,
                               boolean leftTruncated,
                               boolean leftAligned)
        Prints all possible substrings according to arguments. You can make use of createSpacer method.
        Parameters:
        stringToSubstring - the string to substring
        leftTruncated - flag to indicate whether the substrings should be truncated from the left (or the right)
        leftAligned - flag to indicate whether the substrings should be printed left-aligned (or right-aligned)

      • createSpacer

        public java.lang.String createSpacer​(int length)
        Creates a spacer of given length. This solution uses a StringBuilder which is the correct way to concatenate Strings in Java.
        Parameters:
        length - the spacer length, in number of spaces
        Returns:
        spacer
